intro: Diplycosia caudatifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
